That's correct, squaring fitness will increase the chance of something in=
 a local maximum being chosen.  However, it might also cause search to focu=
s more on more promising areas, so it's a trade-off.  There isn't generally=
 one setup that is best for all problems.

Note that in some versions of NE=
AT there is something called a "species dropoff age," which will cause a sp=
ecies to be penalized if it has not improved in some number of generations =
(the dropoff age).  That can help to eliminate those who are stuck.

ken
